scam.description: Victim is told they have won a lottery or prize, but must pay fees or taxes to claim it.

generated.audio_script:
(Korean)(40)(female):
"Hi there! You won our international lottery prize!" A cheerful voice booms over the phone. "Just received your notification? Must be exciting!" "But wait... we need to verify you're serious. Transfer 15% now via bank details provided." "No questions asked, just send it quick so I can process this for you immediately!" "Okay..." The victim stammers. "Don't think too much! It's a standard verification fee. Do it right away or your prize could disappear forever!"
generated.poster_title: You Are the Winner! Claim Your Prize Now!
generated.poster_body: Congratulations! You have been selected as a lucky winner of our international lottery draw worth £10,000. To claim your prize money immediately and avoid losing it to others, please send a processing fee of £500 via Bitcoin payment to address 7cK9Fv8Hg... This is urgent, complete the transaction now for full access.
generated.sd_background_prompt: elaborate gold-framed prize display cabinet filled with enticingly fake trophies under dramatic spotlight lighting, oversized flashy lottery ticket dispenser machine with scrolling winning numbers banners casting long shadows across a cramped cluttered office-like space, numerous cheap plastic chairs arranged precariously in rows facing an intimidating podium stage setup for high-pressure sales tactics., --no people --no text --no logos --ar 4:3
